document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Netomocera Bouček (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Pteromalidae), excluding the Oriental species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Netomocera Bouček (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Pteromalidae), excluding the Oriental species

bibRefCitation.author: Boucek Z.
bibRefCitation.refString: Boucek Z. 1988. Australasian Chalcidoidea (Hymenoptera). A Biosystematic Revision of Genera of Fourteen Families, with a Reclassification of Species. CAB International, Wallingford, Oxon, U. K. / Cambrian News Ltd, Aberystwyth, Wales.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Netomocera sedlaceki
Bouček, 1988: 336
( holotype ( ♀ ) in ANIC, not examined).

subSubSection.paragraph: Body length 0.8–1.2 mm . Mesosoma dorsally with reticulation not dense, alveolae shallow (cf. Fig. 173 ). Funicular segments thick and short, fu1 wider than pedicel, length 1.6–2.0× width ( Fig. 177 ).

AUSTRALIA
– Queensland

–
Australian Capital Territory
• 1 ♂ ; “ AUSTRALIA , A.C.T.: Ainslie ,
8.ii.77
. Bouček”; “ Paratype ”; “ PARATYPE ♂ Netomocera sedlaceki sp. n. Bouček det. 1987”; BMNH
.

Differs from female mainly as follows. Body length: 0.8–1.2 mm . Flagellum uniformly dark brown ( Fig. 177 ). Mesosoma dorsally dark brown except metanotum and propodeum reddish; lateral panel of pronotum, mesepimeron and metapleuron reddish ( Fig. 176 ). Fu1 length 1.6–2.0× width; combined length of pedicel plus flagellum about 2.4× head width. Macropterous, fore wing length about 2.5× width; MV about 3.4 × SV; PV about 1.2× SV. Gaster (when not inflated) much shorter than mesosoma, usually with only gt1 visible.
